args: My blade's bloomin' like a rose in spring...\nNow get ready to cool your heels, bub!
Yeah, doesn't look like that chump got any\ngood licks in, so what say we... Huh?
How come you're making that scary face?
Get behind me, squirt, and no dillydally.
(This ain't no fiendâ€”it's something more\nbloodthirsty. Who in the blazes...?)
I should have known a surprise attack was\nfolly against the granddaughter of that\ndoddering old man.
Hot coffee! You're with the Mukuroshu!
Indeed I am. And if you know that,\nyou must also know why I am here.
I would have the scroll from youâ€”\nthe one which reveals the hiding place\nof the Underworld Key.
Unfortunate. If you will not surrender the\nscroll willingly, I will claim it by force.
(I think this mook's actually aiming\nfor the little squirt there!)
(I ain't gonna be able to close the gap\nand strike him at this rate...)
Heh heh heh. I don't mind a fight where\nmy opponent remains on the defensive,\nbut how long can you keep it up?
Perhaps I'll take your sword arm first. Hah!
You're the leader of the Boar Wyrmclan!
I have disposed of all the Mukuroshu\nhiding in the vicinity.
Sazanka, would you be so kind as to\nattend to Yachiyo's wounds?
Well, shoot! I feel like the fifth wheel on\nthe ol' apple wagon all of a sudden.\nHow long you been here in Alberia?
And the first thing you gotta do is pull my\ntuchus outta the fire. Sorry about that.
I'm merely relieved to find you well.
I've finished treating your wounds.\nFortunately, they were not deep.
Yeah, everything seems jake on this end.\nI owe you one, pal.
By the way, that little girl...?
I saved her from a fiend, but I think that\nMukuroshu cat had designs on her as well.
But she's safe as houses now,\nthanks to you.
Anyway, I gotta get her back to the village\nbefore the sun pulls the ol' switcharoo\nwith the moon.
In that case, Sazanka will accompany you\nwhile Marishiten and I call upon the\nHalidom and offer our greetings.
What? Heck no! You gotta be plumb\ntuckered from all that travel, so take\n'er easy for a bit. I'll be fine.
There is no need to refrain on my account.\nBest to be doubly cautiousâ€”and not only\nto ensure the young lady's safety, yes?
Can't argue with them brass tacks.
Well, the squirt's home safe and sound.\nThanks for the assist there, Sazanka.
I was happy to help; I'm only pleased we\ndidn't run across any Mukuroshu pursuers\nwhile we made our way back.
By the by, are the Mukuroshu what got\nyou stompin' all the way out here?
Yes. We received word of the attack on the\nHalidom from Master Seimei's shikigami.
In response, we were dispatched here and\ntold to figure out a solution to the scroll\ncurrently in your possession.
The one that leads to the Underworld Key,\nyeah? So what'd the shogunate say?

As those keys are essential to Hinomoto's
survival, they desire all information
pertaining to them be held in various
locations by reliable guardians.
So if you find it acceptable, they hope you\nwill continue safeguarding your scroll\nhere in Alberia.
Makes more sense than piling 'em\nall up in one place. Someone could\njust ransack the joint and have at it.
However, I am opposed to the plan.

Your grandfather was a senior statesman
with the shogunate, but his role has been
relinquished, and the connection to it
nominally severed.
With no association to our government,\nthere is no need for you to place yourself\nin danger at our behest.
So I would ask you to refuse this duty and\nsurrender the scroll to Master Ieyasu.
I know you have your own ambitions,\nbut I have no desire for a friend to become\nembroiled in the shogunate's battles.
Well, I'm tickled that you care so much,\nbut I'm still gonna have to sit down and\ngive all this a think.
I am, of course, well aware the scroll is\na memento of your grandfather, and that\nyour decision will not be an easy one.
We are scheduled to depart Alberia in\nseven days time. I would be grateful if\nyou could make your decision by then.
(I wanted to tell her I'd keep it all safe n'\nsound, but that'd be a bold-faced lie.)
(Heck, I'd probably still be leaking red in\nthe woods if not for them coming along.)
(I keep thinking I'm the bee's knees when\nit comes to strength, but it's clear I ain't\neven the bee's ankles yet...)
(Maybe I should let 'em keep\ngrandpappy's scroll safe...)
(I mean, how can I take on his duty if I\ncan't even deal with a single tough...?
